subject: Career
title: Knowing When to Walk Away
description: A quick, practical guide to Knowing When to Walk Away.

hook.text: They won't budge. You've tried three times. At some point, negotiation ends and decision begins.

buildup.text: Your BATNA â€” best alternative to a negotiated agreement â€” determines your walk-away power.

discovery.text: If your alternative is strong (another offer, current job you like), walking away is easy.

twist.text: If you have no alternative, your leverage disappears. Build alternatives before you need them.

climax.text: Walking away with grace keeps the door open. 'I respect the offer but need X to make this work.'

punchline.text: The power to walk away is the power to negotiate.
